docs.title: Hello
docs.description: This is a sample document to demonstrate the Docusaurus documentation structure for the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics textbook.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.description: Welcome to the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics textbook. This comprehensive guide covers the fundamental concepts, practical implementations, and cutting-edge research in the field of physical artificial intelligence and humanoid robotics.

docs.title: Learning Objectives
docs.description: Learning objectives for the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course

frontMatter.title: Learning Objectives
frontMatter.description: Learning objectives for the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course

docs.title: Module 1 Capstone Project: Physical AI System Integration
docs.description: Integrate all Module 1 concepts into a comprehensive Physical AI system demonstrating embodied cognition and environmental interaction.

frontMatter.title: Module 1 Capstone Project: Physical AI System Integration
frontMatter.description: Integrate all Module 1 concepts into a comprehensive Physical AI system demonstrating embodied cognition and environmental interaction.
learning-objectives: Synthesize all Module 1 concepts into a cohesive system
Implement embodied cognition principles in a practical application
Demonstrate environmental interaction capabilities
Apply ROS2 concepts for system integration

frontMatter.description: Test your understanding of ROS2 concepts and implementation for Physical AI systems.

Apply ROS2 communication patterns appropriately

docs.title: 1.3 ROS2 Core Concepts and Implementation
docs.description: Deep dive into ROS2 core concepts with practical implementation details for Physical AI systems.

frontMatter.title: 1.3 ROS2 Core Concepts and Implementation
frontMatter.description: Deep dive into ROS2 core concepts with practical implementation details for Physical AI systems.
learning-objectives: Implement ROS2 nodes in both C++ and Python
Create and use custom message types
Design effective topic and service architectures
Apply Quality of Service settings appropriately

next.title: Week 2 Exercises: ROS2 Introduction and Core Concepts

docs.title: 1.2 Introduction to ROS2
docs.description: Learn about the Robot Operating System version 2, its architecture, and core concepts for robotics development.

frontMatter.title: 1.2 Introduction to ROS2
frontMatter.description: Learn about the Robot Operating System version 2, its architecture, and core concepts for robotics development.
learning-objectives: Understand the purpose and architecture of ROS2
Identify and explain ROS2 core concepts: nodes, topics, services
Describe the role of ROS2 in robotics development

docs.title: 1.4 Embodied Cognition in Physical AI
docs.description: Explore the principles of embodied cognition and how physical form influences intelligent behavior in robotics.

frontMatter.title: 1.4 Embodied Cognition in Physical AI
frontMatter.description: Explore the principles of embodied cognition and how physical form influences intelligent behavior in robotics.
learning-objectives: Explain the principles of embodied cognition
Analyze how physical form influences intelligent behavior
Design systems that leverage embodied cognition principles
Evaluate the role of environmental interaction in intelligence

docs.title: 1.5 Environmental Interaction in Physical AI
docs.description: Explore how Physical AI systems interact with and adapt to their environments.

frontMatter.title: 1.5 Environmental Interaction in Physical AI
frontMatter.description: Explore how Physical AI systems interact with and adapt to their environments.
learning-objectives: Analyze how Physical AI systems perceive and interpret their environment
Design adaptive behaviors for environmental changes
Implement robust interaction strategies for uncertain environments
Evaluate the role of environmental feedback in learning

frontMatter.description: Practical exercises to implement and understand embodied cognition and environmental interaction principles.

Evaluate the role of embodiment in intelligent behavior

docs.title: 1.1 Gazebo Simulation Fundamentals
docs.description: Introduction to Gazebo simulation environment and core concepts for robotics development.

frontMatter.title: 1.1 Gazebo Simulation Fundamentals
frontMatter.description: Introduction to Gazebo simulation environment and core concepts for robotics development.
learning-objectives: Understand the core concepts of Gazebo simulation environment
Set up and configure a basic Gazebo simulation environment
Create and modify simple world files
Spawn basic objects and robots in simulation
Navigate the Gazebo interface and controls

docs.description: Import and configure robot models in Gazebo using URDF and SDF formats.

frontMatter.description: Import and configure robot models in Gazebo using URDF and SDF formats.

Configure joint properties and transmissions for simulation
Set up robot state publishers for proper TF transforms
Spawn custom robots in simulation environment
Validate robot model behavior in simulation

Tune parameters for realistic behavior
Analyze sensor data in simulation environment

frontMatter.description: Configure physics properties and sensor models for realistic simulation in Gazebo.
learning-objectives: Configure physics engine properties in Gazebo
Set up realistic sensor models (cameras, lidars, IMUs, etc.)
Tune physics parameters for realistic simulation behavior
Validate sensor data in simulation environment
Understand the relationship between physics parameters and robot behavior
